qas.question: Where do young people not get informal education?

context: Informal learning is one of three forms of learning defined by the <a0_0><b3_0>Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development<b3_0/> (OECD)<a0_0/>. Informal learning occurs in a variety of places, such as at <a1_0><b4_0><b5_0>home, work, and through daily interactions<b5_0/><a1_0/> and shared relationships<b4_0/> among members of society. For many learners this includes <a2_0><b6_0>language acquisition, cultural norms and manners<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Informal learning for young people is an ongoing process that also occurs in a variety of places, such as <b7_0>out of school time, in youth programs at community centers and media labs<b7_0/>.
